result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Vernon Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Submit an apology to victim in way and manner to be determined by agent.  Enroll in and successfully complete the next available batterer's group.

2:30 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Andre Vernon Smith in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties acknowlege receipt of revocation packet.  DA can certify victims rights compliance.  Recommendation by DA.  Argument by Lex.  Summary by Court.  Court imposes:

Ct 1 - 3 months jail with huber, cs to Ct 2 and any other sentence now in being
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for amounts paid.  Money is due within 30 days from release from custody or CO
Ct 2 - 6 months jail with huber, cs to Ct 1 and any other sentence now in being
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for amounts paid.  Money is due within 30 days form release from custody or CO

Court grants credit of 112 days jail

Appeal rights given.
from DE
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Price County DNA Submission Form

11:05 am - 15CM136 & 15CM142 - Defendant Andre Vernon Smith appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Cts. 1 & 2 in 15CM142.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance. Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Cts. 1 & 2 in 15CM142 and on motion of DA dismisses 15CM136. Comments by parties.  Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:18 am.
Court imposes:
15CM142 - Ct. 1: Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Conditions: $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS and submit sample; $100 DOMAB; Apology to victim in way and manner to be determined by agent; Enroll in and successfully complete the next available batterer's group; Maintain full-time employment.
15CM142 - Ct. 2: Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Conditions: $243 court costs
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Andre Vernon Smith appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue.
Written Consent to Contact
State's Demand for Discovery and Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Tiffany Bruneau, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

11:04 am - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 01-12-16 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
